;周五，一名滑翔伞被困在山坡上，消防员正在寻找他.

;

;警方于周五晚上 10 点左右表示，消防处人员仍在努力寻找这名男子，这名男子较早前在石澳龙脊远足径附近坠毁。

;

;警方发言人

;

;救援行动是在警方于下午 5 点 30 分左右接到警报说该男子的滑翔伞撞到山坡上并且他被困在距离小径约 200 米（656 英尺）的地方后展开的.

;

;救护人员到达现场，并一度叫来直升机帮助搜索。

;

;消防人员在晚上 7 点左右被召集到现场开辟通往坠机的道路

;

;

;飞行范围包括石澳乡村俱乐部、石澳泳滩和德己立角，

;

;

;英国首相 Rishi Sunak 应该为英国对待同性恋和跨性别退伍军人的方式道歉，根据一项政府委托的审查，该审查详细描述了英国军方数十年来普遍存在的“恐同文化”。

;

;这项研究——定于 6 月上半月发表，彭博社看到——详细说明了在 30 多年到 2000 年期间，对任何被怀疑在军队中是同性恋的人进行电击转换疗法、侵入性医学检查和政治迫害，当时禁止同性恋人员在军队服役的禁令被取消。

;

;主要研究发现种族主义在英国“成为日常生活的一部分”

;

;该报告包括欺凌、勒索和性侵犯的证据，并详细说明在某些情况下导致退伍军人心理健康的重大损失

;

;据知情人士透露，其核心建议之一是让苏纳克就历史性政策在议会公开道歉。 /p>;

;政府发言人表示将“仔细考虑调查结果并在适当时候作出回应”。他们没有说总理是否会接受这个建议。

;

;最近的总理为过去政府的政策道歉并不罕见。保守党首相戴维·卡梅伦多次道歉，包括在“爱尔兰动乱”期间发生的血腥星期天大屠杀，当时士兵开枪打死了手无寸铁的平民。

;

;前工党首相戈登·布朗为二战中同性恋者的待遇道歉密码破译者艾伦图灵。在其他地方，加拿大总理贾斯汀·特鲁多 (Justin Trudeau) 就该国在 2017 年在议会中对待 LGBTQ 社区的方式道歉。

;

;英国最大的警察部队“存在体制上的种族主义和性别歧视”

;

;报告建议受歧视性政策影响的人因收入损失和造成的痛苦而获得补偿，并审查他们的养恤金权利。他们中的许多人在因同性恋而被解雇或解雇后失去了养老金。知情人士表示，总赔偿金额上限可能在 5000 万英镑（6200 万美元）左右。

;

;这项研究为近几个月来英国机构和企业内部的歧视现象提供了大量证据。今年 3 月，一项调查发现，伦敦大都会警察局是种族主义、性别歧视和恐同症的温床，并允许警官的掠夺行为猖獗。与此同时，黑人专业人士告诉彭博社，伦敦金融城在实现种族平等的道路上迷失了方向。

;

;这项审查是去年鲍里斯·约翰逊 (Boris Johnson) 担任首相期间委托进行的，其职责是听取受影响者的证词从 1967 年同性恋在英国合法化到 2000 年 1 月禁令被解除，武装部队全面禁止同性恋者参军。

;

;

;

;Terence Etherton，the领导调查的上议院中立议员在序言中将其描述为“在现代人看来，我们武装部队中令人费解的恐同政策的独特记录”。

;

;英国政府表示，它承认历史性政策是错误的，并致力于理解、承认并在适当的时候解决它对 LGBTQ 退伍军人的影响。

;

;他们为保卫我们的国家而服务，”一位政府发言人说。

;

;Etherton 的建议还包括陆军、海军和皇家空军的负责人应该向在和遭受禁令，并恢复被解雇或解雇的个人的佣金和等级。他说，还应恢复军事奖章，并正式恢复制服的穿着。

;

;他说，政府还应该为在军队服役和继续服役的 LGBTQ 退伍军人支付公共纪念费用。

;

;目前尚不清楚有多少人受到禁令的影响，因为国防部没有保存因同性恋而被解雇或开除的人的记录。据估计，有数千人和 1,128 名受到影响的人提交了证据，其中包括目睹虐待的家庭成员和退伍军人。有些人在参军时年仅 15 岁。

;

;“国防部和许多高级军官对这项政策的宣传和执行为其他服役树立了风气各级人员，”埃瑟顿在报告中写道。这是“英国武装部队辉煌历史上的污点”。

;就在匈牙利东部村庄的田园花园和传统住宅之外，一个 gigaproject中国工业正在形成。

;

;推土机和挖掘机已经在准备土地，用于建设占地近 550 英亩的电动汽车 (EV) 电池厂。这座耗资 73 亿欧元（79 亿美元）的工厂将成为匈牙利有史以来最大的外国投资之一，政府希望在政府日益寻求通过改用电动汽车来限制温室气体排放。

;

;但居民、环保主义者和反对派政客担心，这座由中国当代新能源科技有限公司 (CATL) 建造的庞大工厂将加剧现有的环境问题，打击了该国宝贵的水资源供应，并进一步破坏了它对中国的经济。

;

;“当你走过他们正在建设的地区时，你会有一种发自内心的糟糕感觉。 47 岁的当地母亲伊娃·科兹玛 (Eva Kozma) 说，她和建筑工地附近村庄的其他居民一起反对该项目。

;

;这就是未来？在我们知道工厂污染程度如何的情况下将混凝土浇筑在大自然上？”

;

;Kozma 和匈牙利第二大城市德布勒森郊区的其他人说，工厂将建在宝贵的农田上的消息让他们措手不及。他们担心转移到工厂用于冷却设备的大量水会威胁到他们的供水，而且工厂中的化学物质可能渗入土壤和水中，破坏该地区的自然资源。

;

;该地区匈牙利大平原正受到荒漠化的威胁，荒漠化是植被因高温和降雨量减少而退化的过程。气候变化导致的干旱和该地区创纪录的热浪加剧了农业用水和地下水的枯竭，导致农作物减产。

;

;去年，匈牙利经历了有记录以来最热的夏季，近 250 万英亩，或该国 20% 的农田，干涸了。专家表示，除非制定全面的蓄水计划，否则该地区的大部分地区将很快不适合农业生产。

;

;然而，尽管存在这些环境斗争，匈牙利政府认为欧盟逐步停止生产水资源的雄心到 2035 年，内燃机汽车为该国提供了一个独特的机会，使其成为电动汽车电池生产的领导者，并已开始大力推动吸引此类投资。

;

;而且很可能买家：运输占欧洲温室气体排放量的近四分之一，其中超过 70% 的排放量是由公路运输造成的。如果欧盟要在 2050 年实现净零排放目标，电动汽车将发挥关键作用。

;

;宁德时代在德布勒森的 100 GWh 电池工厂预计将创造约 9,000 个工作岗位，是欧洲最大的电池工厂许多 EV 电池工厂在全国各地涌现，这是政府为在匈牙利经营的外国汽车制造商（例如德国汽车制造商奥迪、宝马和梅赛德斯-奔驰）向电池驱动汽车过渡提供服务的战略的一部分。

;

;匈牙利外交部长 Peter Szijjarto 本月早些时候在北京表示，这些德国汽车制造商的存在“激发”了中国最近对电动汽车电池厂的大量投资，并且“这些德国公司的中国供应商继续将匈牙利视为东西方投资的交汇点。”

;

;汽车行业专家 Gabor Varkonyi 同意，吸引电池制造商的努力对匈牙利的经济很有意义——尤其是考虑到每年有 20 多个该国 1% 的出口来自汽车行业。

;

;“这些投资出现在这里非常符合匈牙利的利益，尤其是与德国技术携手合作”，Varkonyi 说。 “这样一来，两者都可以在中期在这里并列，这样一来，没有一方就无法成功开展工作。从这个意义上说，这是绝对的国家利益。”

;

;但是，世界自然基金会匈牙利分部的环境政策专家 Dalma Dedak 表示，尽管有意通过使汽车电动化来减少温室气体排放，但一直缺乏对匈牙利空气、土壤和水的长期后果进行环境影响研究。

;

;锂供应波动、价格战对电动汽车制造商的财务状况构成风险

;

;详情仅在她说，CATL 工厂多阶段建设的第一阶段，因此一旦全面运行，它对环境的影响仍然未知——这削弱了受影响人群与政府之间的信任。

;

;“它令人担忧的是，该工厂第一阶段的审批程序并未显示整个工厂建成后预计会产生什么样的用水量和排放量，”她说。 “也就是说，匈牙利的资源是否足以实施这些雄心勃勃的计划？”

;

;工厂所在的工业园区预计每天的用水量将超过 40,000 立方米（1,050 万） – 德布勒森 (Debrecen) 的饮用水消耗量翻了一番，给处于历史性水危机中的地区带来了沉重负担，Dedak 说。

;

;“从长远来看，这是一个问题，也是一个如何解决问题的问题为这样一个缺水的城市供水，”她说。

;

;宁德时代表示，其 70% 的用水量将来自灰水——经过净化的家庭废水——尽管该计划并非如此目前在工厂第一阶段的环境影响研究中。匈牙

;

;匈牙利议会可持续发展委员会主席 Laszlo Lorant Keresztes 表示，匈牙利的经济“非常容易受到汽车行业的影响，而这个 [工厂] 增加了这种脆弱性。”

;

;本周在反对德布勒森工厂的抗议活动中，Keresztes 表示，匈牙利政府将向 CATL 提供大约 8 亿欧元（8.61 亿美元）的基础设施和税收优惠是“不切实际的金额工作”，而且——就像德国汽车制造商的情况一样——产生的大部分资本将用于出口。

;

;“这些基本上是装配厂，他们从这里拿走了利润。同样典型的是，他们不给匈牙利人工作，而不是给当地人，而是给外国客工，”他说。

;

;德布勒森郊外的一些居民担心大型工厂会带来交通和噪音会破坏他们来抚养孩子的田园诗般的社区。但大多数情况下，他们害怕它可能对他们的自然世界产生不可逆转的影响。

;

;“他们夺取了土地，他们破坏了土壤，他们破坏了空气和水，”Eniko Pasztor 说， 65 岁的一位当地活动家计划在工厂按计划完工后离开该地区。

;

;“没有多少钱可以修复我们毁掉的东西。我们必须确保我们所拥有的仍然存在，”她说。 “我们已经造成了很大的破坏。我不明白为什么我们需要更多、更多、更多”。

;中国固态硬盘 (SSD) 制造商北京 Memblaze 科技有限公司，主要买家美光科技的存储芯片公司于 3 月下旬撤回了其在上海的公开上市，就在北京对这家美国公司展开网络安全调查的前几天。

;

;虽然没有证据表明与美光科技的首次公开募股流产直接相关以美光为例，这家中国公司放弃上市的举动与美国公司被中国国家互联网信息办公室 (CAC) 下属的网络安全审查办公室以国家安全为由进行调查的时间相差三天。

;

; 据知情人士透露，制造企业级固态硬盘的存储解决方案提供商 Memblaze 据说也花费数千万美元以“无退款”条款购买美光存储芯片.

;

;Memblaze 的这些举措反映了北京针对美光的行动，包括事实上禁止其产品在国内销售，可能会如何影响一些本地公司。

;

;中国顶级服务器制造商，据《南华早报》周五援引一位知情供应商的报道称，包括浪潮集团和联想集团在内的供应商已要求供应商暂停装运包含美光制造的存储芯片的模块。

;

;A Memblaze 的媒体代表周五拒绝发表评论，而该公司没有立即回复通过电子邮件发送的评论请求。

;

;美光周五也没有立即回复评论请求。

;

; CAC 的网络安全审查办公室周日表示，美光未通过审查，这导致禁止向中国关键信息基础设施运营商销售这家美国公司的产品。其中包括从电信网络运营商到银行和水务公司的各种实体。

;

;Memblaze 成立于 2011 年，从外国存储芯片供应商处购买 DRAM 和 NAND 芯片，并将它们封装到其 SSD 中。这家总部位于北京的公司没有在其招股说明书中披露其顶级供应商的名称，但文件中的其他信息显示其与美光的密切联系。

;

;Memblaze 董事会成员袁荣曾在上海美光工作，担任根据招股说明书，他在 2008 年至 2011 年间担任首席工程师。 Memblaze 主管张志清于 2009 年至 2011 年在美光担任工程师，随后在 2015 年至 2016 年期间缩短任期。

;

;美国公司子公司美光半导体亚洲公司花费 66 万元根据中国公司注册网站上的公开记录，2021 年 5 月（93,286 美元）收购 Memblaze 1.37% 的股份，几个月前这家中国存储设备制造商申请在技术含量高、类似纳斯达克的科创板上市以及来自上海证券交易所的文件。

;

;美光从中国业务合作伙伴到涉嫌网络安全威胁的路径

;

;在美光销售禁令之后，中国相关业务的投资者正在寻找答案

;

;深圳江波龙是美光在中国大陆最大的客户之一，本周回应投资者的询问时保证其运营“正常且合法”。

;

;中国一直是美光的主要市场之一，占该公司 2022 年 308 亿美元总收入的 11% 左右。这家美国公司预计，由于禁令。

;香港天气预报员将在水银飙升至 35 度时发布新警报摄氏（95 华氏度），并警告老年人等高危人群注意极端高温的健康风险。

;

;香港天文台周五警告说，由于与超级台风玛娃有关的下行气流。

;

;天文台署理助理台长郑元中表示，香港去年有 15 天的极端炎热天气，气温高达 35 度，创历史新高

;

;“我们相信，在全球变暖的影响下，今年我们还将看到大量的极端炎热天气，年平均气温可能会进入历史前 10 名，”程说.

;

;Chinese scientists have found more evidence suggesting that wildfires played an important role in what might have been the Earth's largest mass extinction event around 250 million years ago.

;

;The mega event at the end of the Permian period – long before the rise of dinosaurs – wiped out nearly 90 per cent of marine and land species in a process that is often labelled “the Great Dying”.

;

;Although the direct cause of the annihilation has been widely debated, there is growing evidence to suggest that catastrophic global warming and aridity caused by volcanic activities were major driving factors.

;

;Intense volcanic activities at the time triggered the massive release of greenhouse and other poisonous gases, leading to global warming, frequent wildfires and “aridification”, a process in which a region becomes increasingly dry, Chinese researchers said in a recently published study.

;

;Most previous research into the extinction focused on ocean records during the end-Permian period, but scientists over the past decade have also started to look at the terrestrial records, according to Jiao Shenglin, lead author of the study published in the peer-reviewed journal Earth and Planetary Science Letters last week.

;

;“What is new in this study is that we have used an alternative approach to demonstrate the impact of high -temperature wildfire events on terrestrial ecosystems,” said Jiao, who is a graduate student at the Chinese Academy of Sciences' Nanjing Institute of Geology and Palaeontology.

;

;Ancient mass extinction driven by China volcanoes, study finds;

;In analysing the content of biomarker compounds from a terrestrial site, Jiao and his colleagues were able to conclude that intense wildfire combustion events could have led to the collapse of terrestrial ecosystems and changes in vegetation during the transition from the Permian to the Triassic period about 250 million years ago.

;

;“Poisonous gases and carbon dioxide – released by volcanic activities and wildfire combustion events – increased the global temperature and resulted in the collapse of the ecosystem,” Jiao said.< /p>;

;“The terrestrial ecosystem collapsed at first, and then the organic compounds on the land entered the ocean, causing ocean deoxygenation and acidity, and leading to a deterioration of the ocean environment.”

;

; According to the authors, the terrestrial ecosystem changed from tropical rainforests in the late Permian period to a barren landscape with low-growing vegetation in the early Triassic era. Aridification and extreme global warming also played important roles in increasing the frequency and intensity of wildfire events.

;

;For their study, the scientists analysed biomarker compounds called polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) in 40 samples collected from the Lengqinggou section in Guizhou province of southern China.

;

;The Lengqinggou section is a terrestrial-marine transitional area with deposits from both, and regarded as an important reference point for research of ecosystem evolution in southwestern China during the Permian-Triassic transition period, according to the study.

;

;PAHs in ancient sediments are formed under high temperatures and mainly produced by the incomplete combustion of fuels and plants. Thus they reflect sources related to combustion and are widely used to investigate wildfire activities in geological history.

;

;The study found enriched PAHs in the samples, which suggested a high frequency and intensity of wildfires.

;

;Another geological record-keeping organic matter is charcoal, which is derived from biomass burning. A study by the same research group in 2021 found abundant charcoal in China's western Xinjiang region as well as Guizhou that also supported the theory of frequent wildfire events and vegetation changeover.

;

;“The enrichment of PAHs in the Permian-Triassic transitional interval … indicates that the frequent and intense wildfire events that occurred during this period may have contributed to deforestation and soil collapse of the terrestrial ecosystem in southwestern China,” the authors said in the study.

;

;Extinct-in-wild species in conservation limbo amid 6th mass extinction

;

;Zhang Hua, corresponding author and a researcher with the Chinese Academy of Sciences, said their study showed wildfire events could damage entire regional ecosystems, as their impact on terrestrial vegetation was immediate and often widespread.

;

;“We should increase awareness of the prevention of wildfire events in forests under hot and dry climate conditions,” Zhang was quoted as saying by the state-run Guanming Daily on Wednesday.

;

;“The Earth is getting warmer and wildfires occur in both the northern and southern hemispheres. The current warming may not yet have a significant impact on humans, but it does have a critical impact on the ecosystem,” Jiao warned.

;China has “a lot of opportunities” to expand use of the yuan in its trade and investment with Russia and even among third-party countries, and doing so would represent an important step for China in countering potential US sanctions and becoming the world's top economy, according to a senior Russian banker.

;

;Meanwhile, Beijing should enhance cooperation with its northern neighbour in finance and technology, he said, as the pull-out of Western companies from Russia has left a large market gap for Chinese firms to fill.

;

;The comments by Andrey Kostin, chairman and CEO of Russia's second-largest lender, VTB Bank, came at a time when Beijing and Washington are squaring off in trade, finance and technology, while Russia's backing of the yuan has been a catalyst in the global push for de-dollarisation.

;

;“Each country should think about building economic and financial security by, you know, having alternative ways. Otherwise, it's very dangerous to rely on America,” he told the Post in Beijing.

;

;“Dollar rules the world at the moment … America is using it as a weapon, because by imposing the sanctions they are eliminating some economic competitors. They've got some advantages. But mainly they are using it for political or even military [purposes],” he said in English.

;

;Kostin is part of a large delegation, led by Russian Premier Mikhail Mishustin, that kicked off a state visit to China on Tuesday.

;

;Given unprecedented sanctions imposed by the US and its allies in response to Russia's invasion in Ukraine in February 2022, Russia has turned increasingly reliant on China, which keeps buying bulk quantities of Russian crude oil, natural gas and farm produce.

;

;VTB Bank, which employed 40 people at its Shanghai subsidiary from 2008 and advised on Russian aluminium giant Rusal's Hong Kong public offering in 2010, can play an important role in broader China-Russian cooperation, in which President Xi Jinping has called for “further tapping the potential” and “creating more growth points”.

;

;Like most state-owned Russian banks, VTB was put on the US' sanction list in February last year and subsequently denied access to international financial messaging service Swift and the US dollar.

;

;“We are quite sure that today they're using [financial sanctions] against Russia because they're not happy with Russia. Tomorrow they can use it against China because there's also conflict areas between America and China, Taiwan or other things,” he said.

;

;Beijing, which has seen tensions with Washington escalate since their trade war kicked off in 2018, has been frequently warned that China could face severe consequences for standing together with Moscow, with their trade items scrutinised by Western officials.

;

;The risk of a secondary sanction is a clear and present danger, as evidenced by the Changsha Tianyi Space Science and Technology Research Institute being targeted by the US Treasury Department in January.

;

;The world's second-largest economy has long worried about being cut off from Swift and the US dollar system, despite US President Joe Biden reiterating last week intentions to de-risk, not decouple, the relationship with China.

;

;Chinese officials have criticised Washington's “weaponisation” of the US dollar, which, together with the US Federal Reserve's accumulative 500-basis-point rate hike since March 2022, has resulted in many countries reducing their holdings of US Treasury bills or considering using other international currencies.

;

;China cutting US Treasury holdings 'rational step' amid debt ceiling crisis

;

;Beijing has also quickened the pace of using its home-grown Cross-border Interbank Payment System (CIPS), while ramping up pilot programmes involving the use of its digital yuan in international payments.

;

;The price of financial decoupling is large, as seen with VTB.

;

;The bank alone posted a net loss of US$6.2 billion last year after its business in dollars and the euro was discontinued and its offices in London and Germany were shut down. A year earlier, it reported profits totalling US$3.5 billion.

;

;“We are now working solely in the rouble area, and in addition what we call the 'friendly' currencies,” Kostin said, adding that this year is going to be “quite successful” with billions in net profits.

;

;Increasing overseas use of yuan is widely seen as an important means of countering the US' dollar dominance.

;

;In addition to technical issues such as yuan convertibility, China's capital controls and the stability of its value, the yuan's single-digit shares in international payments, trade finance, forex transactions and foreign reserves remain far behind those of the US dollar and euro.

;

;But Russia's embrace of the yuan – with nearly 11 per cent of Russian deposits now in yuan and about 70 per cent of bilateral trade conducted in roubles and yuan – has significantly raised regional interests in the use of the Chinese currency.

;

;“I think that is a good opportunity, in my opinion, for China to make the yuan an international currency,” said the veteran Russian banker.

;

;Interest in using the yuan for trade settlements has risen in Brazil, Argentina and most recently Uruguay, a traditional backyard of the US, as well as Asian countries such as Saudi Arabia and Thailand.

;

;As 'de-dollarisation reflects cracks' in US dominance, yuan makes inroads

;

;“We are also quite eager for the opportunity to use the yuan for our payments with third countries … Because we have a big balance in trade with some countries. This balance could be compensated with yuan,” Kostin said, following a recent decision to pay for a Russia-Bangladesh nuclear power plant with the yuan.

;

;“It would be an interesting idea to try to implement the digital currency for BRICS countries,” he added, referring to the association of leading emerging markets that comprises Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa.

;

;VTB is currently servicing only about 4 per cent of China-Russian trade, which rose by nearly 30 per cent in 2022 to US$190 billion, and both sides aim to reach US$200 billion this year.

;

;The Russian bank is looking to increase its share of that bilateral trade to about 15 per cent, with business-expansion plans that include adding 20 more workers to its Shanghai office.

;

;“I think there's a good time, too, to bring more business from China to Russia, because Russian assets are priced lower than their actual value,” Kostin said. “Many Western companies are leaving Russia. That's a huge market for China.

;

;“We would like to have more joint ventures in Russia with the participation of Chinese companies – not only buying goods, but also bringing technologies and building some factories, producing something inside the country. Perhaps the countries should look at much more cooperation in innovation, logistics, agriculture, [and] chemical production.”

;

;VTB has expressed interest in joining China's CIPS because doing so would simplify transactions and make them more secure. The bank had said it would raise the issue at a meeting with Chinese central bankers this week.

;

;Despite some bureaucratic obstacles, Kostin said, both sides are working to overcome them, given the “very friendly” relationship between top leaders.

;

;“We are natural partners,” he said.

;

;In his congratulatory letter to the 2023 Zhongguancun Forum, Xi wrote that China is committed to a “win-win strategy of opening-up” and the country is ready to join hands with others to promote sci-tech innovation, according to the letter published by the official Xinhua news agency.

;

;The message comes at a time when technology rivalry between China and the US is deepening, with Washington and its allies tightening export restrictions to China. Meanwhile, Chinese scientists are also coming under greater political scrutiny in the US, with Beijing keen for many of them to return home.

;

;The theme of this year's forum in Zhongguancun, a major technology hub in Beijing's Haidian District styled as China's Silicon Valley, is “open cooperation for a shared future”, and the six-day event has attracted a long list of eminent Chinese and overseas scientists and entrepreneurs.

;

;Microsoft founder Bill Gates, who spoke via a live-streaming feed, said at the forum on Friday that the theme of open cooperation “could not be timelier”, echoing Xi's message.

;

;Gates said global issues such as the Covid-19 pandemic, along with other challenges from food security to child welfare, do not stay within national boundaries. “So we need to commit to working across boundaries to address them,” Gates said.

;

;Gates also told the forum that China, with its mix of expertise and experience and investment in innovation, would be able to make its contribution to the world by sharing its technology and lessons.

;

;“We need to mount a comprehensive, broad response [to issues like Covid-19] based on innovation and cooperation,” he said, noting that China's expertise and manufacturing capacities would help with the world's pressing needs for food and pharmaceuticals. “China is already playing an important role in addressing complex global challenges, including future pandemics and food insecurity,” he told the forum.

;

;Baidu founder and CEO Robin Li Yanhong also delivered a keynote speech on Friday addressing the seismic change that artificial intelligence (AI) will bring via large language models (LLMs), and vowed to integrate such technologies into the real economy.

;This is something Xi called for in his speech to last year's 20th Party Congress, saying that China must promote the integrated development of “strategic emerging industries”, including the information technology and AI sectors among others.

;

;Baidu's answer to ChatGPT, Ernie Bot, is playing catch-up with the chat bot developed by Microsoft-backed OpenAI. ;Ministers from Japan, 12 other Indo-Pacific nations and the US will agree at a meeting Saturday in Detroit to bolster supply chains for chips, medicine and other critical items in the event of an emergency under a US-led economic initiative, sources familiar with the matter said Friday.

;

;The enhanced supply chain resiliency will be the first agreement among the 14 member countries of the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework (IPEF), representing 40 per cent of global gross domestic product, and could help counter China's economic influence in the region.

;

;Supplies of food, energy and key industrial products like semiconductors were disrupted by the Covid-19 pandemic and Russia's war in Ukraine.

;

;The IPEF partners, also including Australia, Indonesia, India, South Korea and Thailand, aim to respond to emergencies more promptly, ensuring the procurement of vital goods and the sharing of information, under a new scheme, according to the sources.

;

;The US-led initiative covers four pillars – fair trade, supply chain resilience, clean energy and proper taxation and anti-corruption – and is also regarded as a symbol of the world's biggest economy's reengagement in the fast-growing region after its withdrawal from the Trans-Pacific Partnership free trade deal in 2017.

;

;Russia and China, which are deepening their economic and security partnership amid increasing tensions with the United States and other countries, are not part of the IPEF.

;

;On Thursday, trade ministers from the Asia-Pacific region opened a two-day meeting in Detroit ahead of the IPEF ministerial meeting to discuss ways to achieve sustainable and inclusive growth, even as the rift over Russia's war on Ukraine hampers efforts to boost regional cooperation.

;

;The 21 members of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation forum include Russia and China, and whether the ministers can find common ground on key issues remains unclear. The United States, chair of this year's forum, aims to compile a joint statement at the conclusion of the meeting.

;

;Also on Thursday, US Commerce Secretary Gina Raimondo and Chinese Commerce Minister Wang Wentao met in Washington and had “candid and substantive discussions on issues relating to the US-China commercial relationship”, the US side said.
